articles.title: Mars Wasn’t Dry After All. Its Ancient Lakes May Have Survived Beneath Thin Ice - Indian Defence Review
articles.description: Lakes on early Mars may have remained liquid for decades under thin, seasonal ice, even while surface temperatures stayed far below freezing.
articles.content: The research, led by a team at Rice University, suggests that ancient Martian lakes did not require a warm climate to persist. Instead, a thin ice cover may have slowed evaporation and heat loss, all… [+3915 chars]
